author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Poland there commences a vote,
To choose the leader of men of note.
For Ukraine they pled, debate turning red,
The wine of democracy, from the cask is outpoured, good'n'noble folk.

Now Russia and Israel, a delicate dance,
Shattered by Hamas' truculent stance.
Their kinship dost wane, in the Ukrainian plane,
As the ale of discord tasks each with a curious prance.

Rejoice, economists do, the U.S. remains bold,
The chalice of prosperity they confidently hold.
No more the dread recession's ghost,
Inflation's sting too hath lost most,
Just like the wine that grows better when old.

feedItems.title: Poles Are Voting in What Could Be Europe's Biggest Election This Year
feedItems.description: Support for Ukraine has emerged as a core campaign issue, with an upstart party driving the debate to the right.

feedItems.title: Hamas Attack Ends a Delicate Entente Between Russia and Israel
feedItems.description: The development highlights a tectonic shift in Russia’s role in the Middle East since Putin launched his war in Ukraine.

feedItems.title: A Recession Is No Longer the Consensus
feedItems.description: Economists are turning optimistic on the U.S. economy. They think the Fed is done raising interest rates and inflation will continue to ease.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the land of bayous, dwellers of swamp and sedge,
Jeff Landry asserts his rule, through the electoral edge.
More than half the voices raised, through fourteen choices echoed,
Song of the wolf pack rings true, Louisiana's power hath been rededicated.

Of the Wall Street Journal, a missive of future's ways,
An oracle unseen, in data's arcane maze.
Quests answered, links discovered, in the survey's grand design,
Thus do the seers of commerce, their destinies divine.

Gold, the gleaming serpent, slinks in new attire,
It lurks not in a purse, but sparks a virtual fire.
In digital halls it dwells, unseen, unheard the song,
Cash is dead, long live code: the new battle strong.

feedItems.title: Jeff Landry Elected Louisiana Governor in a Crowded Field
feedItems.description: Republicans reclaimed the governor’s mansion in Louisiana Saturday when the state attorney general won more than 50% of the vote in a crowded field of 14 candidates.

feedItems.title: About The Wall Street Journal Economic Forecasting Survey
feedItems.description: Answers to frequently asked questions about the survey plus links to survey stories and archival data.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Huskies' lair, a clash of faith,
Ducks rival, ending in wraith.
A pass so late, in final gasp,
Won tides of fortune in their grasp.

A ship sailed forth towards distant crests,
Urined drink quenches the desperate guest.
But destination's mockery spun,
His Americas were undone.

For Africa's offspring, an errant mist,
Unknown Brazil in unclenched fist.
Dreams of North, in promise weaved,
Yet South's deceit cruelly received.

feedItems.title: Washington's Electric Offense Wins Out in a Thriller Against Oregon
feedItems.description: A late TD pass by Michael Penix Jr. to Rome Odunze—one of several talented receivers who elected to stay at Washington—lifted the No. 7 Huskies to a big win over the No. 8 Ducks.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: He clung to the ship's rudder, drinking his own urine to survive, all so he could make it to America. One problem: he was headed somewhere very different.

feedItems.title: Desperate to Flee Africa, Migrants Accidentally Stow Away on Ships to Brazil
feedItems.description: African arrivals are tricked to believe they were headed for the U.S. or Europe.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In realms vast, 'cross emerald sky, rival systems ascend high,
Gold offered by the Western lands, no more the sole command,
Russia, dragon of the east, and Europe in their celestial feast,
Sit poised with satellite bands, as old America's star too gently lands.

Once golden coin did hold the sway, now coupon is the day's array,
Behold, a question doth emerge from fiscal sea, so stiff and sterge,
Would a mere trifle truly cast, the card and app to mists of past,
Or does gold's whisper still hold fast, within man's ironclad grasp?

A star of stage and silver screen, a siren's song now silenced seems,
Piper Laurie, known so well, 'pon wings of time, she softly fell,
In roles of 'Hustler', 'Carrie' too, her fame and talent in life grew,
Now to yonder heaven ascends, her tale and time in beauty ends.

feedItems.title: America's 'Gold Standard' GPS Risks Falling Behind Rival  Systems
feedItems.description: China, Russia and the European Union have developed satellite networks offering global-positioning services as the U.S. system ages.

feedItems.title: Cash Is the New Coupon
feedItems.description: Is a 3% cash discount enough to make people ditch credit cards and payment apps?

feedItems.title: Actress Piper Laurie, Known for Roles in 'Carrie' and 'The Hustler,' Dies at 91
feedItems.description: The Detroit-born actress had a long and award-winning career that began in the 1950s and spanned movies and television.
